description.narrative: Country programme is effectively planned, monitored and evaluated, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Country programme is effectively planned, monitored and evaluated

description.narrative: In 2021, the third year of the country programme 2019-2023, the office held a strategic moment of reflection to take stock of progress made and to identify opportunities to accelerate results for children. The focus on early childhood and adolescent life-cycle programming was reinforced in the new rolling workplan July 2021-June 2023, which was signed by the Government. The office continued to engage in various monitoring initiatives to ensure adaptive programming and has developed a new situation analysis snapshot to inform the UN Common Country Analysis and the upcoming development of the UNSDCF and the UNICEF country programme 2024-2027.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021
